data.title: Cultural Heritage Site - Shigaraki, Japan: Michio Sugiyama, former director at the Shigaraki Ceramic Cultural Park and current director of...
data.meta_description:
207 likes, 5 comments - moca_newyork on November 27, 2023: "Cultural Heritage Site - Shigaraki, Japan: Michio Sugiyama, former director at the Shigaraki Ceramic Cultural Park and current director of Shigaraki Share Studio, collaborates with MoCA/NY on a feature providing historical, cultural, and political insights on one of the oldest pottery producing regions in Japan. Shigaraki is known as having one of the “six ancient kilns of Japan”. Learn about the historical traditions that shaped this renowned pottery-producing center and how Shigaraki is considered a world center for ceramics, creating a new culture based on historical tradition. Michio’s commitment to bringing awareness to the importance of Shigarki’s ceramic traditions has helped to preserve this important cultural site for generations to come. Read the full feature on our website – Link in Bio

Shigaraki is linked on our Ceramic World Destinations Map on our website. Visit to learn more.

Stay tuned for the upcoming features of this three-part series on Shigaraki, which will highlight the ceramic artists currently living and working in the cultural heritage site.

Contact us if you would like to feature ceramic destinations for your city or share an event, exhibition, research, or publication.

@air_sccp @michio.sugiyama #MOCANY #MuseumOfCeramicArtNewYork #shigaraki #shagarakiceramicculturalpark #japaneseceramics #ceramicart #japaneseart #pottery #contemporaryceramics #contemporarysculpture #ceramicsculpture #ceramicartist #ceramicart".
